channel.title: Location of clicking?
channel.description: Where would I be able to change the location of where you click the login box? Im not able to find it.

item.title: Location of clicking?
item.dc:creator: @ringer24 ringer24
item.description:
@ringer24 wrote:

Thrasher Alpha:

Even if I add that I have to declare to look in the file to make it work, what would I put over the Log In code so it has my custom login pic and it uses that?

I’ve been messing around with the 317 client but i have not been successful, I only have a blank login box. =\

Some 317 useful things…

anInt833 - Login Screen State
method140 - show LogIn
method84 - LogIn
method64 - reset Login Screen
method7 - createLogIn

Read full topic

item.title: Location of clicking?
item.dc:creator: @ringer24 ringer24
item.description:
@ringer24 wrote:

this is the code that you really wont need:

    aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_967.method361(i1 - 73, 16083, l1 - 20);
                aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method382(0xffffff, i1, anInt939, "@whi@Log in", l1 + 5, true);
                i1 = c / 2 + 80;
                aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_967.method361(i1 - 73, 16083, l1 - 20);
                aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method382(0xffffff, i1, anInt939, "@whi@Cancel", l1 + 5, true);

Make a new java file:

import java.awt.*;
import java.applet.*;
import java.awt.event.*;

public class mouseEvent implements MouseListener {

	public mouseEvent(){
		Main.gameFrame.addMouseListener(this);
	}

	public void mouseExited(MouseEvent m){
	}

	public void mouseEntered(MouseEvent m){
	}

	public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent m){
	}

	public void mousePressed(MouseEvent m){
	}

	public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent m){
		int x = m.getX();
		int y = m.getY();
		if(x < 403 && x > 186 && y < 407 && y > 335){
			if(Main.level == -1){
				Main.level = 1;
			
			}
		}
		System.out.println(x+", "+y); //click on the applet to find coords of mouse

	}

}

This was just an example file!
